reasoning: Malignant fibrous histiocytoma (MFH) is a specific histological subtype of soft tissue sarcoma, representing approximately 20-30% of adult soft tissue sarcomas. Global soft tissue sarcoma incidence is 2-3 per 100k; MFH subset estimated at 0.6 per 100k. Modern classification reclassifies many cases as undifferentiated pleomorphic sarcoma (UPS), creating uncertainty in historical vs. current incidence estimates.
